meanings.definition: The perception or awareness of the position and movement of one's own body.
meanings.sent1: Her proprioceptions helped her balance while walking on the narrow beam.
meanings.sent2: Athletes rely on their proprioceptions to coordinate their movements during a game.
meanings.sent3: The robot's malfunctioning proprioceptions made it dance awkwardly.
meanings.sent4: His proprioceptions were like a compass guiding him through the dark room.
meanings.sent5: Learning to trust your proprioceptions is essential for mastering yoga poses.

meanings.definition: The sense of the relative position of neighboring parts of the body and strength of effort being employed in movement.
meanings.sent1: Children develop their proprioceptions through activities like climbing trees.
meanings.sent2: Physical therapists work on improving patients' proprioceptions after injuries.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's enhanced proprioceptions allowed him to dodge attacks effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: In the chaos of the crowd, her proprioceptions acted like a guiding light.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's impeccable proprioceptions mesmerized the audience with her graceful movements.
